line_1: Ah blame me not, Broderip, if mounted aloft,
line_2: How can I imagine thy foppery soft,

line_1: To me the sky-larks, pois'd aloft,
line_2: And hail no more in warblings soft

line_1: The Roof began to mount aloft;
line_2: THEY scarce had Spoke; when, fair and soft,

line_1: He sent the godly sounds aloft,
line_2: Now striking strong, now soothing soft,

line_1: "The bark by tempests that is whirl'd aloft,
line_2: With visage bland, methought she hail'd me oft;
And the proud steed neigheth oft'
With vermeil cheek and whisper soft
And begg'd him to play something soft:
